moves.11... Nh5: I'm not sure about this move : it opens the diagonal giving efficiency to the DSB but is a call for a further g4 and second move for an already developped piece. On the other hand it covers the f4 square, a weak point in white's position.
moves.12. Bg5: bold reaction to black's last move.
moves.14. Re1: I see nothing better. Until now both players play very prudently (we had a lot of benoni together before this game...)
moves.14... Rb8: To prepare an attack on the queenside
moves.15. Qd2: Joining the rooks and preparing a kingside attack
moves.15... Bg7: The DSB is back in his lair
moves.16. g4: White has developpement advance and control more space. I estimate that some risk is ok. The aim is an attack on d6
moves.17... Ne5: Knight on the center.... defensive and offensive move (menacing a fork attack by 18. ... Nxf3+)
moves.19... Qc7: unpinning the knight.  At this point, I see a possible tactic.
moves.20. Bc4: preparing a further d6, blocking the c pawn, pinning the f pawn.
moves.20... Bd7:
To join the rooks. The LSB has no other proper place to go.
More dangerous : it menaces 21. ... b5
moves.21. Ba2: To prevent the main menace if 21. ... b5 and keep white's plan on the center available.
moves.21... b5: Black launches his attack on the queenside
moves.22... Qb6: Qc8 would probably have been better
moves.24. Nd5: Fork attack between b6 and f6
moves.25. Nxf6+: Black has only one move available
moves.26. Qxd7: Now white is ahead in material but has serious positionnal weaknesses (3 unprotected pawns and a weak king) which  black, undoubtedly will try to exploit.
moves.27. Qc7: There were few alterbatives (27. Qb7 is death because of 27. ... Re7). 27. Qa7 gives the same result than 27. Qc7
moves.28... Rxb2 29. Bd5: Closing the open file and protecting the e pawn at little risk because black has no more pawns available to fire the bishop.
moves.29... b4 30. Ra2 Rxa2 31. Bxa2 Rb8 32. R: I hesitated between several possibilities (43.f4 ; 43. Bc6). I finally elected this one because there is still a risk of draw and I wanted to try to take a free pawn without exchanging.
